docs.snippet: Embattled Los Angeles Clippers owner Donald Sterling has agreed to sell the team for $2 billion and will drop his lawsuit against the National Basketball Association, his lawyer Maxwell Blecher said on Wednesday, five weeks after taped racist rema...
docs.lead_paragraph: Embattled Los Angeles Clippers owner Donald Sterling has agreed to sell the team for $2 billion and will drop his lawsuit against the National Basketball Association, his lawyer Maxwell Blecher said on Wednesday, five weeks after taped racist remarks Sterling made caused the NBA to ban him for life.

headline.main: Sterling Agrees to Clippers Sale, Will Drop NBA Lawsuit
headline.print_headline: Sterling Agrees to Clippers Sale, Will Drop NBA Lawsuit

docs.snippet: More than 100 suspected gang members who have turned two Harlem housing projects into a "war zone" have been charged with a string of violent crimes in the largest gang indictment in New York City history, authorities said Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: More than 100 suspected gang members who have turned two Harlem housing projects into a "war zone" have been charged with a string of violent crimes in the largest gang indictment in New York City history, authorities said Wednesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Municipal Art Society plans to give its Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis Medal to Bruce C. Ratner, builder of the Atlantic Yards development.
docs.abstract: Municipal Art Society plans to give its Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis Medal to Bruce C Ratner, builder of the Atlantic Yards development in Brooklyn; plan comes under attack by activists and city preservationists who say Ratner's organization is more bulldozer than builder.

headline.main: Plan to Honor Big Developer in Brooklyn Is Criticized
headline.print_headline: Plan to Honor Big Developer in Brooklyn Is Criticized

docs.snippet: The presence of Glen Sather, the Rangers’ general manager who won five championship rings with the Oilers, lent a certain kind of old-fashioned hockey star power to media day....
docs.lead_paragraph: The presence of Glen Sather, the Rangers’ general manager who won five championship rings with the Oilers, lent a certain kind of old-fashioned hockey star power to media day.
docs.abstract: New York Rangers general manager Glen Sather lends air of confidence and star power to team's media day as it prepares for Game 1 of the Stanley Cup finals; Sather has led team to its first finals appearance in 20 years.

headline.main: Sather Is Used to Stanley Cup Finals, if Not With the Rangers
headline.print_headline: Rangers’ Boss Comfortable in Finals Spotlight

docs.snippet: LeBron James should be used to the NBA Finals by now. After five trips to the championship series in eight years, it would make sense if he had a been-there, done-that attitude when stepping onto the sport's biggest stage....
docs.lead_paragraph: LeBron James should be used to the NBA Finals by now. After five trips to the championship series in eight years, it would make sense if he had a been-there, done-that attitude when stepping onto the sport's biggest stage.
